gurmukhi: ik pwpwsqR brKy ]ik DrmwsqR krKy ]ArogwsqR Cu`ty ]suBogwsqR su`ty ]60]287]
transliteration: Ki Paapaastra Barkhe|| Ki Dharmaastra Karkhe||darogadstra Chhoutte|| Soubhogadstra Soutte||50||287||
translation: The voice of the shower of Papastras (the sinful arms) and the crackling of Dharmastras (the arms of Dharma) is being heard; Arogastras (the health arms) and Bhogastras (the pleasure arms) are also being discharged.60.287.

transliteration: Bibaadaastra Sajje|| Birodhaastra Bajje|| Koumantraastra Choutte|| Soumantraastra Toutte||61||288||
translation: Vivadastras (arms of dispute) and Virodhastras (arms of opposition), Kumantrastra (arms of bad spells and Sumantrastras (arms of auspicious spells were shot and then burst.61.288.

gurmukhi: ik kwmwsqR Cu`ty ]kroDwsqR qu`ty ]ibroDwsqR brKy ]ibmohwsqR krKy ]62]289]
transliteration: Ki Kaamaastra Choutte|| Darodhaastra Toutte|| Birodhaastra Barkhe|| Binphaastra Karkhe||62||289||
translation: Kamastras (arms of lust), Karodhastras (the arms of anger) and Virodhastras (arms of opposition) were shwered and Vimohastras (arms of detachment) crackled.62.289.

gurmukhi: cirqRwsqR Cu`ty ]ik mohwsqR ju`ty ]ik qRwswsqR brKy ]ik kRoDwsqR krKy ]63]290]
transliteration: Charitraastra Choutte|| Ki Mahaastra Joutte|| Ki Traasaastra Barkhe|| Ki Krodhaastra Karkhaa||63||290||
translation: Charitrastras (arms of conduct) were shot, the Mogastrass (the arms of attachment) collided, the Trasastras (the arms of fear) rained and Krodhastras (arms of anger) crackled.63.290.

gurmukhi: ieh ibD SsqR AsqR bhu Cory ]niRp ibbyk ky Bt JkJory ]Awpn clw insir qb rwjw ]BwNq BwNq ky bwjn bwjw ]64]291]
transliteration: Eh Bidh Shastra Astra Bahu Chore|| Nrip Bibek Ke Bhat Jhakjhore|| Aapan Chalaa Nidar(i) Tah Raajaa|| Bhaant Bhaant Ke Baajan Baajaa||64||291||
translation: In this way, many warriors of king Vivek were given a jerk and they left their arms and weapons; then the king himself moved and many types of musical instruments were played.64.291.

gurmukhi: duhuidis pVw inSwny Gwqw ]mhw Sbd Duin auTI AGwqw ]brKw bwx ggn gXo CweI ]BUiq ipswc rhy aurJweI ]65]292]
transliteration: Duhudis(i) Padaa Nishaane Ghaataa|| Mahaa Shabad Dhoun(i) Outhiaghaataa|| Barkhaa Baan Gadan Gyo Chhaade|| Bhoot(i) Pisaach Rahe Urjhaaee||65||292
translation: The trumpets sounded form both the sides and there were thundering noises; the rain of arrows spread on the whole sky and the ghosts and fiends also got entangled.65.292.

gurmukhi: iJim iJim swru ggn qy brKw ]Bl Bl suBt pKrIAw prKw ]ismty suBt AnMq Apwrw ]pir geI AMD DuMD ibkrwrw ]66]293]
transliteration: Jhim(i) Jhim(i) Daar(i) Gadan Te Barkhaa|| Bhal Bhal Soubhat Pakhreeaa Parkheeaa|| Simte Soubhat Anant Apaaraa|| Par(i) Gadandh Dhoundh Bikraaraa||66||293||
translation: There was steady rain of iron from the sky and there was testing of the great warriors alongwith it; the innumerable warriors gathered together and got contracted; there was dreadful mist on all the four sides.66.293.

gurmukhi: niRp ibbyk qb rosih Brw ]sB sYnw kh Awiesu krw ]aumfy sUr su Pauj bnweI ]nwm qws kib dyq bqweI ]67]294]
transliteration: Nrip Bibek Tab Rosah(i) Bhaara|| Sabh Sainaa Kah Aais(u) Karaa|| Oumde Soor Su Phauj Banaaee|| Naam Taas Kahi Det Bataaee||67||294||
translation: The king Vivek, getting enraged gave orders to his whole army; all those warriors who arrayed themselves in an army; all those warriors who arrayed themselves in an army rushed forward, the poet now tells their names.67.294.

gurmukhi: isrI pwKrI top svwry ]iclqh rwg sMjovw fwry ]cly ju`D ky kwj su bIrw ]sUKq BXo ndn ko nIrw ]68]295]
transliteration: Siripaakharitop Savdare|| Chiltah Raag Sanjovaa Dare|| Chale Juddh Ke Kaaj Su Beeraa|| Sookhat Bhayo Nadan Ko Neeraa||68||295||
translation: The warriors wearing helmets on their heads and armour is on their bodies and bedecked with various kinds of arms and weapons, marched for fighting; the water of the streams dried up in fear.68.295.

gurmukhi: duhU idsn mwrU bjXo prXo inSwny Gwau ]aumf du bhIAw auiT clY BXo iBrn ko cwau ]69]296]
transliteration: Duhoo Disan Maroo Bajyo Daryo Nishaane Ghaao|| Oumad Du Baheeaa Outh(i) Chalai Bhayo Bhiran Ko Chaao||69||296||
translation: The deadly musical instruments were played form both the directions and the trumpets thundered; the warriors fighting on the strength of both their arms, rushed forward with the zeal for fighting in their mind.69.296.
